content: I have a PR. It's not a big one, not too important, and does not fix bugs. When should I expect it to release with a stable release? Is there a way to track this somehow?

You can see what "milestone" it's in like this:

And track when it'll be released here: https://forge.rust-lang.org/#current-release-versions
Thanks. What if the PR was never milestoned?
The milestone is just an information for humans, which is added automatically by @rustbot

If for some reason the PR doesn't get milestoned, e.g. rustbot is down when the PR is merged, you can check out https://forge.rust-lang.org/#current-release-versions to know what the current nightly version is and when it will be released, as explained by hyd-dev above
Please file an issue on rust-lang/triagebot for non milestoned PRs
(or at least give me a ping on Zulip)
@simulacrum Here's an example merged PR without a milestone: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/82755
I fixed a bug that led to error log spam, will keep an eye out - if you notice it on a very recently merged pr, that would help in debugging.
